title: Rosler sacked as Leeds coach
text:
Rosler sacked as Leeds coach Monday October 19, 2015 Print Article 
Rosler, 46, was appointed as Neil Redfearn’s replacement in May but becomes the fifth Leeds boss to be axed by controversial chairman Massimo Cellino. — AFP pic LONDON, Oct 19 — Championship strugglers Leeds United have sacked head coach Uwe Rosler after just five months in charge, the club announced today. 
Rosler, 46, was appointed as Neil Redfearn’s replacement in May but becomes the fifth Leeds boss to be axed by controversial chairman Massimo Cellino. 
Former Rotherham boss Steve Evans apparently took charge of first-team training this morning. 
Leeds slipped to a third straight defeat on Saturday, losing 2-1 at home to Brighton, and lie 18th in the table, three points above the relegation zone. — AFP
